definition:
Let $X$ be a topological space and let $x\in X$. $X$ is said to be *at
$x$* if there is a sequence $(B_n)_{n\in\mathbb{N}}$ of open sets such
that whenever $U$ is an open set containing $x$, there is
$n\in\mathbb{N}$ such that $x\in B_n\subseteq U$.

The space $X$ is said to be ** if for every $x\in X$, $X$ is first
countable at $x$.

**Remark**. Equivalently, one can take each $B_n$ in the sequence to be
open neighborhood of $x$.
